title: Well reminded
content:
I was traipsing around the internet recently and came across [Daniel Rhatigan's picture of an old Monotype specimen on Flickr](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013005959/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/ultrasparky/3218770932/) and his mention of an [older thread here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013005959/http:/typophile.com/node/28292)

Tiffany says that it looks like the italic for Renner's Steile Futura, which is the starting point of another massive discussion [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013005959/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18227) (which I confess I missed at the time). And I agree with her – the two faces are startlingly close, but Daniel's date for the Monotype specimen pre-dates Steile Futura by at least a decade.

At last I have got off my arse and done something about it (outlines in progress below), but the question I want to ask now is _"Is Monotype Condensa an (English) knock-off of the (German) Steile Futura Italic?"_

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013005959im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Condensa_outlines_5483.jpg)
author: ben_archer
